//: American Association of University Women (AAUW) Dissertation Fellowship
name: American Association of University Women (AAUW) Dissertation Fellowship
notes: The purpose of this fellowship is to offset a scholar’s living expenses while she completes her dissertation. The fellowship must be used for the final year of writing the dissertation.

//: American Association of University Women (AAUW) International Fellowship
name: American Association of University Women (AAUW) International Fellowship
eligibility: Identify as a woman; must not be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident
notes: Provides support for women pursuing full-time graduate or postdoctoral study in the United States to women who are not U.S. citizens or permanent residents, and who intend to return to their home country to pursue a professional career.

//: Center for Engaged Scholarship (CES) Dissertation Fellowship
name: Center for Engaged Scholarship (CES) Dissertation Fellowship
notes: Supports a year of research and writing to help advanced graduate students in the humanities and interpretive social sciences in the last year of PhD dissertation writing.

name: Chateaubriand Fellowship
support: Up to €14k/mo stipend + round trip ticket to France + health insurance
notes: Supports outstanding PhD students from U.S. institutions who wish to conduct part of their doctoral research in France. US and French advisors must agree to co-supervise part of the student's thesis. Knowledge of French is not mandatory and is left to the discretion of the host institution. This fellowship is offered by the Embassy of France in the United States.

name: Critical Language Scholarship (CLS) Program
notes: The CLS Program is a fully funded summer overseas language and cultural immersion program for American students to learn languages essential to America's engagement with the world. Languages include Arabic, Azerbaijani, Bangla, Chinese, Hindi, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean, Persian, Portuguese, Punjabi, Russian, Swahili, Turkish, and Urdu. See here for more information. This award does not satisfy the external funding requirement.

name: David L. Boren Graduate Fellowship
support: Up to $25k for 25-52 weeks (preferred) or $12.5k for 12-24 weeks; plus up to $12k for domestic language study (optional)
notes: Provides unique funding opportunities for U.S. graduate students to study less commonly taught languages in world regions critical to U.S. interests, and regions that are underrepresented in study abroad programs, including Africa, Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Eurasia, Latin America and the Middle East. The countries of Western Europe, Canada, Australia and New Zealand are excluded. See here and here for more information.

name: Facebook Fellowship Program
notes: Awarded to doctoral students engaged in innovative and relevant research in areas related to computer science and engineering. While open to students in any year of PhD study, a heavy emphasis on research and publication record for Facebook Fellowships favor students who are further along in their program.

name: Ford Foundation Dissertation Fellowship
notes: Supports basic science in the domain of human language, encompassing investigations of the grammatical properties of individual human languages, and of natural language in general. Research areas include syntax, linguistic semantics and pragmatics, morphology, phonetics, and phonology. The program encourages projects that are interdisciplinary in methodological or theoretical perspective, and that address questions that cross disciplinary boundaries.

name: Ford Foundation Predoctoral Fellowship
notes: Awarded to individuals who have demonstrated superior academic achievement, are committed to a career in teaching and research at the college or university level, show promise of future achievement as scholars and teachers, and are well prepared to use diversity as a resource for enriching the education of all students.

name: Foreign Language & Area Studies (FLAS) Fellowship
notes: Supports undergraduate, graduate and professional students in acquiring modern foreign languages and area or international studies competencies. Students from all UW departments and schools are encouraged to apply. Languages include: Arabic, Bangla, Bosnian/Croatian/Montenegrin/Serbian, Burmese, Chinese, French, Hebrew, Hindi, Indigenous languages spoken in Canada, Indonesian, Inuktitut, Japanese, Kazakh, Khmer, Korean, Persian, Portuguese, Russian, Swahili, Tagalog, Thai, Turkish, Urdu, Uyghur, and Vietnamese.

name: Fulbright-Hays Doctoral Dissertation Award
notes: Provides funding for dissertation research abroad for graduate students pursuing non-Western European area studies. Geographic areas include: Africa; East, Southeast, and South Asia, Pacific Islands; Near East; East Central Europe and Eurasia; and the Western Hemisphere (excluding the United States and its territories).

name: Generation Google Scholarship
notes: Established to help aspiring students pursuing computer science degrees excel in technology and become leaders in the field. The scholarship is awarded based on the strength of each candidate's commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, demonstrated leadership, and academic performance.

name: Google Lime Scholarship
eligibility: Identify as having a visible or invisible disability
notes: Partners with Lime Connect, a nonprofit organization that supports students with disabilities while they pursue education and promising careers, to help university students with disabilities work toward their academic goals in the field of computer science.

name: Google PhD Fellowship
eligibility: Students who will have completed their graduate coursework and are underrepresented in the field of computing [see Description]
notes:
Recognizes graduate students doing exceptional and innovative research in areas relevant to computer science and related fields. Fellowships support promising PhD candidates of all backgrounds who seek to influence the future of technology.

Universities may nominate up to four eligible students. If a university chooses to nominate more than two students, the third and fourth nominees must self-identify as a woman, Black/African descent, Hispanic/Latino/Latinx, Indigenous, and/or a person with a disability.

//: Graduate Women in Science (GWIS) National Fellowship
name: Graduate Women in Science (GWIS) National Fellowship
notes: Promotes knowledge in the natural and social sciences and encourages women’s academic and professional careers in the sciences.

name: International Dissertation Research Fellowship (IDRF)
notes: Supports the next generation of scholars in the humanities and humanistic social sciences pursuing research that advances knowledge about US Indigenous or non-US cultures and societies.

name: Mellon/ACLS Dissertation Completion Fellowship
notes: Supports a year of research and writing to help advanced graduate students in the humanities and interpretive social sciences in the last year of PhD dissertation writing.

name: Microsoft Dissertation Grant
eligibility: Students underrepresented in the field of computing
notes: Aims to increase the pipeline of diverse talent receiving advanced degrees in computing-related fields by providing a research funding opportunity for doctoral students who are underrepresented in the field of computing. This includes those who self-identify as a woman, African American, Black, Hispanic, Latinx, American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, Pacific Islander, LGBTQI+, and/or person with a disability.

name: Microsoft Research PhD Fellowship
eligibility: Students who will be starting their 3rd year and are underrepresented in the field of computing [see Description]
notes:
Aims to increase the pipeline of talent receiving advanced degrees in computing-related fields to build a stronger and inclusive computing-related research community.

PhD students must be nominated by their department (up to four nominees per department). At least half of the nominees must be identify as being underrepresented in the field of computing.

name: Norton Labs Graduate Fellowship
notes: Aims to fund innovative research that has real-world value and aligns well with key areas of Norton Labs' business. Topics of interest include: privacy and identity, security, machine learning, and human factors (e.g., applications of psychology, sociology, linguistics, and other human sciences to security and privacy.) Each award includes a salaried internship with Norton Labs.

name: NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program (GRFP)
eligibility: Completed no more than 1 year of graduate study by the August before the application is submitted [confirm eligibility here]
notes: Intended to help ensure the vitality and diversity of the scientific and engineering workforce in the United States. The program recognizes and supports outstanding graduate students who are pursuing research-based master’s and doctoral degrees in fields within NSF's mission. Supported fields of study include: social sciences, chemistry, computer science and engineering, engineering, geosciences, life sciences, materials research, mathematics, physics and astronomy, psychology (non-clinical), and STEM education research.

//: NSF Linguistics Program - Doctoral Dissertation Research Improvement Grant (Ling-DDRI)
name: NSF Linguistics Program - Doctoral Dissertation Research Improvement Grant (Ling-DDRI)
notes: Supports basic science in the domain of human language, encompassing investigations of the grammatical properties of individual human languages, and of natural language in general. Research areas include syntax, linguistic semantics and pragmatics, morphology, phonetics, and phonology. The program encourages projects that are interdisciplinary in methodological or theoretical perspective, and that address questions that cross disciplinary boundaries.

name: Open Phil AI Fellowship
notes: Supports full-time PhD students focused on artificial intelligence or machine learning. The programs seeks to support a small group of the most promising PhD students in AI and ML who are interested in research that makes it less likely that advanced AI systems pose a global catastrophic risk. Fellows will be funded through the end of the 5th year of their PhD

name: UW Presidential Dissertation Fellowship
support: Predoctoral TA II (ASE) rate + tuition + GAIP
notes: Assists PhD candidates in the final stages of writing their dissertations.
